post_title: How much is that doggy in the window?
post_content:
1909 T206 Burchell-creasing, paper loss on the back, corner wear and a brown stain where his lips meet on the left of the card-$20.00 (Sold)

1909 T206 Mowrey-creases, stain in the top left yellow background and heavy corner wear-$20.00

1909 T206 Leifield batting-a hair shorter than the other T206s and miscut-$40.00

1909 T206 Wilson-creases everywhere, paper loss obliterating most of name plate in the bottom border. Paper overlap of the top of the two "T's" as well as the end of the top of the first "E" and the tops of the second "E" as well as the "S" in "CIGARETTES" on the back. That said the card is an old mill and has a stamp beginning with the name "Hugh". The middle of the last name in this verticle stamp has been lost to the same problem previously mentioned in "CIGARETTES"-Sold.

1909 E90-1 Wallace-offered as authentic-widening of border from one side to the other in the top border, but not offset the other way in the bottom border. Spot of paper loss over the "P" in "PA" on the back lower right-$100.00

S/h is $5.00 unless you live in California, Oregon or the state of Washington in which cases the s/h is $5.50.  If paying by PayPal, please pay by PayPal Gift/Friends and Family to [url]wizard15243@yahoo.com[/url].
